intro: Osbeckia pityrophylla, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Osbeckia pityrophylla is a member of the family Goodeniaceae and is known for its compact growth habit. It plays a role in stabilizing dune environments and provides nectar for pollinators.
